intro: Heliocarpus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy fruit tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, red fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Heliocarpus hirtus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal contexts.
